intro: Bouffordia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Olacaceae. It consists of several species, primarily native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are characterized by their milky sap, which is often used in traditional medicine. They typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. Bouffordia species are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique appearance and hardy nature.
